Anh - s Easy RidersĐọc thêm

I was on a five day trip together with my sister from Hoi An to Dalat. Our drivers were Anh and his younger brother Dung. Both of them were very entertaining and very knowledgable about the land, the minority people, their customs and culture. If you are looking to really getting a feeling for the different ethnic minorities and their ways of living and working I couldn - t think of a better way than to go with these two guys, since they will tell you strange and crazy stories about traditions that are unique to some group or another. Since most of these people do not speak English and some not even Vietnamese, there is really no way of making such and hands-on experiences on your own. Of the two brothers my sister - s driver Dung was the more chatty one, who would always tell you all kinds of interesting and peculiar things. Anh on the other hand was a little more of a quite type. But he was just as experienced and knowledgable and would always be happy to inform you or explain how certain work-procedures were conducted by the local people. Also, he had a lot of extraordinary stories to tell about things he had experienced, his own life and his family, which was very enjoyable and worth having heard.Another great thing about the trip was the food. Almost every day we would be eating family food, which is many kinds of food served on many plates, such that everyone on the table can eat and take whatever they want. All the food was delicious and often unique to the place we were visiting. Many of the places we visited were very beautiful and also sometimes quite remote, so we would be the only tourists there. Whenever we had a request for stopping and taking photos, they were more than willing to do so. Also Anh is a fantastic driver, who will make you feel save on the back of the bike even in the middle of the crazy Vietnamese traffic. There are a few things that might be good to know before starting the trip. First, most of the activities during the trip will require a ticket, so be prepared to pay some extra money. Also, lunch, dinner and breakfast will most of the time have to be paid extra. The prices are usually cheap though, except for the elefant ride, which was pretty expensive.Also, while some of the accomodations during the trip were fine, some others were not very clean at least by European standards. For us that didn - t hamper the experience though.It was generally the case that all the people we interacted with during he trip were very friendly, open and helpful, which is an interesting experience in and of itself, when you are not used to something like that from your home country.Both me and my sister very quickly took the two brothers into our hearts and I am happy to say that we became friends during our trip.Overall the trip was surprising, exciting, fun, funny and totally worth the investment. I will take away many great memories from it.Read more

It was really easy to book the two day tour we had with Anh as he is very responsive to emails. Anh and Te picked us up on their motorbikes from our hotel and strapped our backpacks on the back of them and we always felt very safe on their bikes. Vietnam traffic can seem hectic but you learn by being on the back of a bike that everyone just slows down at junctions, everyone is patient and this must be how they don - t have accidents. We stopped frequently and explored Da Nang before finishing up in Hoi An which was our next destination. It - s great Anh can tailor your trip to your needs and he told us he has done tours up and down the country sometimes for weeks and you can even ride your own bike and just follow him. My partner and I done this trip before getting married in Hoi An and he gave my now husband some great advice on how he should keep me happy, like giving me a foot massage haha it was all in jest and Anh had a great sense of humour. It - s very clear that Anh loves his country and his wife and you can ask him anything, he will always have a good answer. He has been doing tours for over 20 years so really does know what he is talking about. At each stop he will tell you some information or let you explore. Day 1 we stopped opposite Monkey mountain, Marble mountain  - you pay your own entrance fee and go at your own pace, Anh will be waiting for you when you - re ready which is great - , Da Nang Bridge, Hai Van Pass  - Anh took some great pictures of us here - , American - French war bunkers, local waterfall  - stopped for lunch at cafe nearby -  a cinnamon tree  - gave me a little bark -  green tea plantation before stopping over in a hotel in the countryside where we had dinner. Day 2, visited the Katu Tribe and got to see how they lived, even got invited into a hut to drink rice wine and have some pork, stopped at a Dam, a pineapple farm  - delicious - , stopped at a cafe for lunch, rode through rice paddie fields, got a boat ferry with the bikes across a stream, stopped at My Son  - again Anh waited for us and we just took it in our time -  a farm where they make rice paper, a broom factory  - I say factory but it is one packed room -  and stopped for a sugar cane juice. It was a great trip and really insightful into how Vietnamese people live. Thank you very much Anh : -  Read more

Chuyến tham quan bằng xe máy
attraction_summary: Anh - s Vietnam Easyriders cung cấp các chuyến tham quan bằng xe máy qua Tây Nguyên Việt Nam, phía bắc đến Động Phong Nha qua thành phố Huế và phía nam đến thành phố Đà Lạt qua Nha Trang và thành phố Hồ Chí Minh. Các chuyến tham quan của chúng tôi mang đến cơ hội duy nhất để bạn thoát khỏi đám đông điên cuồng, bạn sẽ tìm thấy trên con đường du lịch được du khách yêu thích. Chân thực và khó quên, bạn sẽ được trải nghiệm cảm giác chân thực ở Việt Nam. Chào mừng bạn đến với Anh - s Easyriders với dịch vụ rất chân thật và vui vẻ.Đọc thêm
reviews: Tôi và một người bạn đã thuê Anh và anh trai anh ấy đưa chúng tôi đi tour hai ngày một đêm bắt đầu từ Đà Nẵng và kết thúc ở Huế. Họ đón chúng tôi tại khách sạn của chúng tôi. Xe đạp của họ rất thoải mái với mũ bảo hiểm tốt, ghế mềm có tựa lưng và giá để hành lý nơi họ buộc chặt hành lý của chúng tôi - trong một chiếc túi chống thấm nước - . Hai anh em thực sự thân thiện và nói tiếng Anh tốt. Họ lái xe rất giỏi và tôi luôn cảm thấy an toàn khi đi cùng Anh. Trước chuyến đi, chúng tôi đã nói với họ nơi chúng tôi muốn đến và xem và họ có thể kết hợp điều này vào chuyến tham quan. Chúng tôi đã thấy một số cảnh đẹp tuyệt vời và họ đã giải thích rất nhiều điều cho chúng tôi. Những nơi chúng tôi dừng lại để ăn trưa rất tuyệt và thời gian lưu trú tại khách sạn rất thoải mái với đồ ăn tuyệt vời. Đó là một cách tuyệt vời để ngồi lại và tận hưởng vùng nông thôn mà không phải lo lắng về việc tự lái xe. Tôi thực sự muốn giới thiệu công ty này và tôi chắc chắn sẽ tham gia một chuyến tham quan trong tương lai với họ. Đọc thêm

Anh is a very good driver and the trip was a great experience.  The scenery and landscape of the Mountain area is very scenic often following rivers and offering some spectacular views. If you would live to take a photo you must tell as he doesn - t stop so often.  You may see Green tea plantations , encounter minority people and look into the simple life of the rural area. Also the driving is great fun but was also pushing me a bit to the limits as I haven - t done it before.  I also had to drink a lot water as it was already quite hot around  lunchtime. The first night stay was with in a family who offers several rooms.    Please keep in mind that hygenic surrounding is far below European standard. If you are sensitive I would recommend a thin sleeping bag  - silk or  so -  and to inform about diseases in rural areas and take precautions or simply keep in mind. We ate along the way at small cusines from local people.  The second stay was in a hotel in a langer town which had some other European visitors passing by with bikes. The standard of the hotel was still simple as the rooms were already a bit run down but it had nice views and looked a bit French style. The cafe in front was very nice with green plants and was  also visited by local people who could afford for breakfast. We had very nice and good food in the evening and I could speak to some Vietnamese visitors  - those who know English -  and had to sing for them.  - I was awful -  Further on we went passing more small villages and lakes to gain electricity. When we went to see a gum tree  - Kautschuk -  only a few meters from the road I had a blood eagle on my leg which we could remove. So be careful especially after rain to step into forest with green grass. I will always remember this trip and am happy that I dared to do it.  Our way back home was feeling a quite long drive with a nice stop at Hoi An were I walked along the scenic streets for some time and then back to Da Nang. Read more

We travelled with Nha Trang Easyriders 7 years ago and with our two teenage boys in tow had a fantastic time so we had to try a repeat. It didn - t take long to find a couple of guys with bikes sporting EASY RIDERS HOI AN on the front number plate at which point we should have gone right over and introduced ourselves. Sadly we mentioned our plans to another local who took us over and introduced us, we thought it was fine at the time but did discover later that he scored a nice US - 60 commission for the intro! A big chunk of the total US - 390 we paid for a three day tour, the price covering hotels with breakfast.Deposit paid, Kieu and Thai  - Anh was busy on another tour -  picked us up for an early start to beat the other tourists to My Son Sanctuary via the back roads and through scenery you - d probably not get to see on your own.  I - ve ridden for 37 years in the UK Europe and New Zealand and it - s tempting to hire bikes and do it yourself, but when you - re riding you - re watching the road and missing the scenery, also you do not have the Vietnamese riders skill set. You may think you - re doing great, but the locals ability to spot and dodge round errant foreigners is a major part of your survival. The guys know all the good photo spots and interesting things to visit, mountain villages, farms, waterfalls  - complete with locals who want to share a few beers with you, well, it - d be rude not to! - . For us the highlight was getting up onto the Ho Chi Minh road and up into real jungle covered mountains. The roads are mostly empty bar a few herds of cows and locals from the ethnic minority villages and the views and scenery are fantastic.You stay in small local hotels or guest houses and get to stop for delicious and cheap lunches at the spots locals use so it - s an experience and insight into real Vietnam. I - ve seen a few whinges about the hotels from others who have missed the point, you are with regular Vietnamese guys and stay where they stay, eat where they eat. If you want a luxury tour feel free to pay for one and enjoy the view from your aircon - d bus or limo.Kieu and Thai were great company, good safe riders and invariably got us to the bigger tourist destinations before the crowds in coaches and limo - s arrived. If you want a special experience then an easy riders tour is the way to go.Read more

Để bắt đầu, chúng tôi đã thực hiện một chuyến tham quan trong ngày dọc theo đèo Hải Vân với những tay đua dễ tính. Chúng tôi đã có một ngày tuyệt vời đến mức chúng tôi quyết định đi du lịch đến de lat từ Hội An cùng họ. Đó là tour 5 ngày 4 đêm, lúc đầu chúng tôi lo lắng về chi phí tour. Nhưng hãy để tôi trấn an bạn, đây là số tiền tốt nhất tôi đã bỏ ra cho đến nay trong 3 tháng đi du lịch. Lời hứa của những tay đua dễ dàng - Trải nghiệm thực tế ở Việt Nam - họ cá nhân hóa chuyến tham quan theo những gì bạn thích và vượt xa hơn nữa để đảm bảo bạn có một chuyến đi thú vị. Bạn sẽ được ngắm nhìn vùng quê xinh đẹp của Việt Nam sau lưng xe đạp và khám phá, ngắm nhìn những điều mới mẻ mỗi ngày. Chúng tôi là y tá và hỏi liệu chúng tôi có thể đến bệnh viện địa phương không, và họ đã làm đúng như vậy, họ đưa chúng tôi đến bệnh viện địa phương và chúng tôi phải đi xem xung quanh. Tôi rất buồn khi chuyến tham quan kết thúc vì chúng tôi đã trở thành bạn với các tay đua của mình. Chúng tôi ăn những món ăn địa phương của Việt Nam và uống nhiều bia để học một số ngôn ngữ trên đường đi. Tôi ước mình có thể thực hiện lại chuyến tham quan. Tôi rất hạnh phúc và cảm thấy thực sự may mắn khi có được trải nghiệm tuyệt vời như vậy trong tay những tay đua giàu kinh nghiệm. Tất cả các tay đua đều rất an toàn và chu đáo, quan tâm đến nhu cầu của chúng tôi và mục tiêu tâm hồn của họ là đảm bảo khách hàng hài lòng. vì vậy nếu bạn đang tranh luận về việc có nên làm điều đó 100 hay không - vâng vì đó là điều tốt nhất tôi đã làm ở Việt Nam. Anh là tay đua của tôi và tôi cảm thấy 100 - an toàn khi ở bên anh ấy. Anh ấy là một tay đua giàu kinh nghiệm và chăm sóc bạn rất tốt. cảm ơn Bảo, Anh, ty - Suu vì trải nghiệm tuyệt vời nhất mà tôi đã có, các bạn thực sự là một nhóm tuyệt vời và tôi rất buồn khi phải nói lời tạm biệtĐọc thêm

3days 2nights. Hoi an - Prao - Khe Sanh - Phong Nha.24-26 of AprilI was initally gonna go with Ahns brother but they both showed up the morning of departure. I didnt quite get the reason for this but was told Ahn was better in english. This may seem a bit strange though i got nothing but good vibes so we took off.At first we went and had a look at the local market were I got an Hoi An cigar  - a rolled tobacco leaf - . Strong as hell but I liked it even though i dont smoke. We visited a small broomfactory and after that a ricepaper factory. Nice women at both places with what seems like extremely repetative jobs.Had a cooling stop at a waterfall then up the mountains and visited the  - Honor -  of a part of the Kotu minority people  - hope i got that right - . He was a sweet old man, 94 years old living with his family, dogs chickens and two pythons. For a mere sum of dong you could take a picture of them around your neck. I did not dare. Had a look at grean-tea plantation then a little weaving factory. Up in the mountain the views was beginning to pile up and maybe thats why I felt like the day had been short when we stopped in Prao. Though 10minutes later there was a thunderstorm with heavy rain so glad to be inside.The room was ok but for 300k i expected more especially since there was no power during the night  - no ac - . The good thing was that Ahn had arranged with the lady of the house to cook us dinner dinner  - 50k - . One of the best meals i had in vietnam so far. The next day we sat out for 220km - if i remember correctly - . We had a quick stop at another Kotu-village and saw their common-house.Then...MARVEL. The views and the beuty the whole rest of that day is hard to describe. It was green, so green everywhere except the small villages we drove by and the water in the canyons. The cliffs decending into the valleys then up the next mountain and the silhuetts of mountains behind...The only comparable memory I have is when i drove on Lofoten  - Island in the far north of Norway -  with its mountains and cascade of colours.And as a bonus there were happy children in every village waving and screamin helliuuuu.When we arrived in Khe Sanh i walked around the platuea of the old american military base  - now museum - . Very intersenting to see the vehicles  - transported there - . Though a big minus for the annoying salesmen  - war trinkets - .The hotel we stayed on was ok but i got a doubleroom, for 300k again, mjaah. Then we went out to eat and had a few beers. Ahn taught me the extreme importance of the vietmanese pronunciation. As well as new phrases. I hope they stick!Breakfast at the hotel was a bit pricy I think but the coffe was terrific.The last day we went down the mountain again and I started to miss the views. We had a stop at an Pagoda, they were furthering the construction but it was a nice stop anyways with beatiful trees and flowers.Quick stop at a coffehouse without coffe cause the power was out. A nice guy with a really beatiful place though and we had a coke. We had a stop at a memorial for the vietmanese who died at the ho cho min trail. This was.. Majestic might be the word. It was beatiful with flowers on all graves  - although it was plastic lotus - .Before we got to our destination we had a stop at a rubbertree-farm. Ahn showed and told me about the process. Very interesting, dont think I ever had the process explained to me before.Then we saw the beatiful mountains at Phong Nha.I had a very good trip with a great driver. In the mountains, the roads are occupied by cows, sheeps, dogs, chickens and other drivers as well as people walking about. Ahn handled every little situation very well and I was never afraid there. The only time I got a bit scared was the last day with more heavy traffic. The bus- and the cargodrivers all cheated the turns, but as stated above, Ahn is a very safe driver.And do tap him on the shoulder when you wanna snap a picture. - Somehow I can only access my pictures from the last day - Read more
